title: The Case of the travelling garden
creator_contributor_role: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, production company
subject_group: Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Plant diseases - Australia
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Plant quarantine - Australia
Agriculture, Business, Commerce & Industry/Agriculture - Australia - Safety aspects
Agriculture, Business, Commerce & Industry/Agriculture - Australia - Safety aspects
description: The Department of Customs checks on all plants being brought into Australia and administers agricultural quarantine regulations. Travellers are required to leave behind all fruit and vegetables, flowers and bulbs for these may be disease-carrying. Australia is fortunate in having so much agriculture which is free from any overseas pests and diseases. Uses animation. (For the Plant Quarantine Publicity Campaign, 1972).
